System.Obsolete("This class has been deprecated. Please use WebRequest.DefaultWebProxy instead to access and set the global default proxy. Use 'null' instead of GetEmptyWebProxy. https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=14202")

Docs.summary: Contains a global default proxy instance for all HTTP requests.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.GlobalProxySelection> stores the proxy settings for the default proxy that <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> instances use to contact Internet sites beyond the local network. The default proxy setting is initialized from the global or application configuration file, and can be overridden for individual requests or disabled by setting the <xref:System.Net.HttpWebRequest.Proxy%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property to the result of the <xref:System.Net.GlobalProxySelection.GetEmptyWebProxy%2A> method.
The proxy settings stored in <xref:System.Net.GlobalProxySelection> are used by any <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> derived objects that support proxies and have their <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.Proxy%2A> property value set to `null` (the default). Proxies are currently supported by <xref:System.Net.FtpWebRequest>, <xref:System.Net.HttpWebRequest>, and <xref:System.Net.WebClient>.
**Note** Changes to the <xref:System.Net.GlobalProxySelection> after a request is made are not reflected in a <xref:System.Net.WebRequest>.
## Examples The following code example sets the <xref:System.Net.GlobalProxySelection> for an HTTP proxy named "webproxy" on port 80.
[!code-cpp[Classic GlobalProxySelection Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic GlobalProxySelection Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic GlobalProxySelection Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic GlobalProxySelection Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic GlobalProxySelection Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic GlobalProxySelection Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Net.IWebProxy GetEmptyWebProxy() cil managed
Public Shared Function GetEmptyWebProxy () As IWebProxy

remarks.format:
## Remarks
The <xref:System.Net.GlobalProxySelection.GetEmptyWebProxy%2A> method returns a blank <xref:System.Net.IWebProxy> instance to indicate that no proxy is used to access an Internet resource.
Instead of calling the `GetEmptyWebProxy` method, you can assign `null` to members such as the <xref:System.Net.WebClient.Proxy?displayProperty=nameWithType> property, which specifies the proxy that communicates with remote servers on behalf of the <xref:System.Net.WebClient> object.
## Examples The following code example creates a <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> instance that does not use a proxy.
[!code-cpp[NclEmptyWebProxy#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLEmptyWebProxy/CPP/test.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[NclEmptyWebProxy#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLEmptyWebProxy/CS/test.cs#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the global HTTP proxy.
Docs.value: An that every call to uses.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.GlobalProxySelection.Select%2A> property sets the proxy that all <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> instances use if the request supports proxies and no proxy is set explicitly using the <xref:System.Net.HttpWebRequest.Proxy%2A> property. Proxies are currently supported by <xref:System.Net.FtpWebRequest> and <xref:System.Net.HttpWebRequest>.
## Examples The following code example sets the <xref:System.Net.GlobalProxySelection.Select%2A> property to the empty proxy.
[!code-cpp[NclEmptyWebProxy#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLEmptyWebProxy/CPP/test.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[NclEmptyWebProxy#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLEmptyWebProxy/CS/test.cs#1)]
